Reviews.Title: “Refreshing break”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: ~We found a directional response online helpful for finding this hotel (since Italian house numbering seems to be a law unto itself) but once found, of course, there were no further problems. Our room was good - very nicely refurbished. The bed was comfortable and facilities all good. And yes, a kettle was provided or hot water on request. Breakfast was plentiful with a good 'continental' choice. The area is pleasant and interesting with easy access to other areas of Venice No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: Harrassedmum04
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel were mixed so we were nervous. Our experience was all good. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable. We did have to wait for a table for breakfast but well, that's the way it goes! We've stayed in Venice once before and this hotel was as good as the previous one. It's a small hotel, not a Best Western or Holiday Inn etc. so we didn't expect that sort of luxury. We thought it was good. The area, Arsenale, is fantastic! Restaurants and bars are much cheaper than those in the centre and the walk into St Marks was beautiful. We took a number of different routes. I would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valmet78
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel Booked this hotel on someone's recommendations, and boy what a mistake. To our amazement, our room was not in the actual hotel, but a grungy little room around the corner. To enter the room, a hotel staff member has to leave the hotel, a walk with you to the building to let you in. The room was camped, and stunk. The t.v. only had two stations, and when I asked them to fix it, they tried to sluff me off.. I made hotel staff have a look at it, and they just shrugged their shoulders. Of the three hotels I stayed at in Italy, all of equal value, this hotel's breakfast was not to standard. The hotel staff are useless. If you have a question, they just try to sluff you off, or give you incorrection information. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: keithwebb255093
Reviews.Content: I have travelled the world and this is the worst hotel ever stayed in. mould in bathroom and mould in margarine when opened for breakfast. air cond never worked, bath plumbing flowed from botton of bath on to floor. tv never worked, shower holder broken so limited showering. Friends travelling with us had to move to another room as theirs, smelt so bad..Please do not go to this dreadful,disgusting hole,

Reviews.Title: “it was quite a walk.....”
Reviews.Author: machtes
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small, tho it tries to be comfortable. July which is indeed a busy month in Venice, the breakfast room is not enough for all the guests. Many guests arrives to have their breakfasts but unfortunately have to wait for a table, ( and who would like to rush a breakfast specially if you are on holidays!)...... Surely this inconvenience will be solved as soon as they open the extension on the side of the building. The staff didnt know of the precise schedules of museums! which we think are essential info for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition in a small package”
Reviews.Author: p_l_h_uk
Reviews.Content: Delivers above expectation for a 3 star hotel in Venice. Room safe and fridge included in price. Quiet position close to ferries for all destinations including the airport. Ten minute walk to San Marco. Close to bustling via Garabaldi with its small food shops bars and food. Good continental breakfast, obliging staff (No problem to provide an very early breakfast when required) Our STANDARD room and en suite had dolls house proportions and Grand Ducal decour !. In a STANDARD room expect to battle with shower proportions and waredrobe access if you have a history of over indulgence in pasta. We noticed there were larger rooms. The hotel enhanced our Venice experience. Stairlift to First Floor.

Reviews.Title: “This is a smart little hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewstew
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel have been quite varied, so we didn't really know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised. Our room was in the Annex, and everything -furnishings, decorations,fittings - seemed straight out of the box. Possibly it's had a recent makeover, but it's very smart, clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast (continental), fresh and plentiful. It's a bit tricky to find, being in an alley behind Via Garribaldi. Getting there from the airport was simple, and by far the easiest way was to take the Alilaguna Water Bus Blue Line from outside the airport (turn left at the exit and follow the walkway) -tickets can be bought online before travel and a voucher emailed to you which you exchange at the booth by the ferry. Get off at Arsenale (stops are well sign-posted), turn right and cross over two canal bridges. Via Garibaldi is then immediately on your right. Walk a couple of hundred metres until you see a cash machine on your right on the main street. The alley towards the hotel is directly opposite that. We'd have no hesitation in going back both to Venice and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My friend and I recently spent two nights...”
Reviews.Author: gennh
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently spent two nights in this hotel, two to many. Unfortunately for us this made our time in Venice a disappointing one, could not wait to leave. The first night we where put in a pig pen about 300m from the hotel, we booked and paid top dollarâ‚¬250/night for our room months ago so we expected nice acc in return. After staying in 3 star acc in Rome, Cingue Terre and Lake Como we where clearly able to compare the room we had the first night as '1' star, disgusting! The room was dirty, no hot water or pressure, rubbish everywhere. The second night we where put in another room, which proved even more how we where shafted the first night. Of course anything would have been better, but still poor standard, intermittent water supply, fridge did not work. Overall the hotel was dusty, dirty and a bad vibe, with untrustworthy staff. As we where told we where put in a â‚¬ 360/ night room on the second night, what a load of [---]. We got a current pricing from him as well which shows the most expensive room in high season as â‚¬260.Â

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel but far away!”
Reviews.Author: varuniaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff tried to make the stay as comfy as possible, inspite of knowing that the air-conditioner did not work!!! It can become real warm during day time and the AC is a must! It was when we insisted that we got another room on a different floor. Far away from the centre; with no other means of luggging your stuff, it can be a pain to do to-and-fro. The rooms were cozy. Had mosquitoes!!! Breakfast was decent. Bathroom was clean and small. Staff was helpful. the hotel was amidst residential area, right next to a super market. And yes, there was no lift to take your luggage up the very-small staircase, right up to the 2nd floor! It was out-right-- painful!

Reviews.Title: “Venice without a heart”
Reviews.Author: Harokopio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very unpleasant mostly because the staff and the management were particularly unfriendly and unhelpful. Venice has been about tourism for a few hundred years or more but this hotel has avoided any of the skills and finesse associated with good service, good value and good management. Go to Venice, just avoid staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: tsarsteve
Reviews.Content: We did a 9-day vacation in Rome, Florence, and Venice and this hotel was, by far, our favorite. The hotel is situated in a quiet, residential neighborhood about a 10 minute walk from St. Mark's. While it made the trip to and from the train station and airport time consuming, we enjoyed the peace and quiet, especially after experiencing the mobs of other tourists in St. Marks. Our room was small but elegant, very clean and very comfortable. The hotel staff was helpful and polite, and we liked the breakfast every morning. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Old Venice charm”
Reviews.Author: MaciejK
Reviews.Content: Located in off of typical tourist area but only 15 min. walk from S. Marco. Residential neighborhood with everyday life atmosphere. Very quiet at night. Entrance from back alley. 10 min. walk from Arsenal or Giardini vaporetto stop. Nice breakfast. Warning for bigger in size guests: very small shower, no elevator (lift). No cable or wireless internet in the room. Our bed mattress was very firm. Too firm for my taste. I thought it was good value for pricey Venice but would pay a little extra to have regular bathroom and softer mattress, if I could. Warning: do not let them put you in an additional apartment located off site.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel ... just SMALLEST shower and NO elevator.”
Reviews.Author: James-Laynie
Reviews.Content: We booked through European Destinations and Venice was our last stop (after visiting Rome and Florence). This hotel was easy to get to by taking the water bus (vaporetto) #1 from the train station to the Arsenale stop. The #1 stops at just about EVERY stop along the Canal, so if you want a shorter route to get you there a little quicker, just find any other water bus that stops at Arsenale. The signs are very easy to read. After getting off the Arsenale stop, go right. You're going to go over 2 bridges. The first one had stairs (so I hope you packed light) and the second bridge had a ramp. Turn left after the second bridge onto Via Garibaldi. Another TripAdvisor had it exactly right...go about 200 yards just before you hit the white building, which is a church. You might ask youself, "Where? What white building? Would you consider that building white?" Don't worry, keep walkig you'll see it. JUST before the building, turn left. You'll be walking just alongside the church. The you will see signs for the hotel. You'll make another left and then see the entrance to the hotel. LIKES: (1)Staff. Namely just the front desk person who is really the only person you see besides the people that help serve breakfast in the morning. (2) Internet use. It's a small hotel, so be nice, flash a smile, and ask if you can use the one at the front desk. (3) Another boutique hotel that is literally in the middle of a neighborhood. You can witness real Venetian life being here and it it is definitely not far from the 'sites' since Venice is so small. DISLIKES: (1) The shower. Just when we thought the shower couldn't get any smaller than one the in Rome, WRONG! But again, after an exhausting day of sight seeing and shopping - you're still glad you get to take a shower! (2). No elevator. No kidding. So pack light! Which you should have done anyway when going to Europe. GETTING AROUND: Walking is a good way to explore Venice since it is so small. But, the water busses (vaporetti) are easy to use. We bought the 3-day pass for each of us. But like the other cities, no one every checked. So you can take a gamble and hop on a water bus to go where you want without paying, but risk getting fined if caught. GETTING TO THE AIRPORT TO GO HOME FROM VENICE: If you're like us and will be flying out from Venice back home (to the U.S.). Take the #42 water bus (from Arsenale) to the last stop, Piazzale Roma. This will take less than 30 minutes. As soon as you get off this station you can just follow the crowd towards the bus station. Buy a bus ticket from the ticket booth. It will be the #5 bus, which can be caught at the A1 platform. This will take about another 30 minutes to get to the airport. **Good thing we bought our bus tickets (2.50 Euro each) here because there were 2 "officials" that hopped on from one of the bus stops along the way to the airport and checked every passenger for a valid ticket. However, the bus police person gave us trouble saying that we don't have the right ticket or something rather. She questioned how much we paid for them, where we bought them, for our receipt (which we could not find). Eventually, she let us go and just telling us that next time we need to keep our receipt. I wasn't worried though because I knew that we were honest and we did buy tickets from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice, quiet as can be.”
Reviews.Author: travelwith2teens_8
Reviews.Content: Castello is a great neighborhood. Quiet, local, and close to St. Marks. Via Ghirabaldi is a great place to shop like a local, eat at a local restaurant, shop in a grocery store, etc. The staff is helpful, the rooms are ok, considering they are in Venice. Don't expect a view, and the apartment room across the street could use a refurbishment. A good budget choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: applew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommand by local people, we think it's a nice hotel because it have good location (near the bus station / cheap super hotel / nice park), also yammy breaksfat, staff also very considerate about everything. We have very nice memory here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location away from tourist throngs”
Reviews.Author: JPSaleebyMD
Reviews.Content: We reviewed several hotels and since we had a budget and the US Dollar was weak against the Euro we decided on this one based on our budget. Once we arrived in Venice we were delighted to see that the hotel was away from the masses of tourists, yet close enough to everything. Rooms are small (very small), bathrooms are stuffed with plenty of room devoted to a bidet with no room for a "real" shower. Would stay again, since it met our needs, the staff was more then nice and the breakfast was good. You awake to the wonderful scents of breakfast. JP & Sharon Saleeby SC, USA

Reviews.Title: “Corte Contarina -”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire_Daniel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Corte Contarina in Venice. We travelled to Venice from Treviso, the easiest and cheapest way to get there is to take the connecting ATVO Eurobus service. Bus times coincide with Ryanair arrivals and departures, and the fare is much cheaper than a taxi, only â‚¬5 one-way or â‚¬9 return. Purchase your ticket at the ATVO counter in the airport and stamp it in the ticket-validation machine on the bus. (If you need a ticket from Venice to Treviso Airport, go to the ATVO ticket office in the Piazzale de Roma). Remember to ask for a bus timetable before leaving the airport so that you can plan your return journey, although usually they have somebody handing them out near the exits. You'll need to allow about one hour for the bus trip, the end of the line is the Piazzale de Roma, where you can catch a vaporetto (water bus) to your hotel. When you get off the bus head towards the main entrance and keep left, do not cross any bridges, just keep left until you reach the Vaporetto stops, all within a few yards of each other. A single fare is valid for 60 minutes (which is plenty of time to get to the hotel) and costs â‚¬6 per person, however you can get a 24 or 72 hour ticket which cost â‚¬16 and â‚¬30 respectively. You can take the number 41/42/51 or 52 Vaporetto down to Arsenale, but I would recommend the number 1 Vaporetto, it travels through the grand canal and in my opinion gives the best initial impression and views of Venice, it also seemed more readily available. As mentioned take No. 1 Vaporetto down to Arsenale, from here, we walked over two bridges and turned left onto Via Garibaldi. After about 200 yards look for a big white building on your left, which is a little church called San Francesco di Paola, turn left here, (before not after the Church) then left again and you are at the Corte Contarina front door. If you reach the canal you have gone too far, although when you turn around you will then see the sign which is only viewable from one direction, which is only when you have gone too far as we did. Because of the walking, a suitcase with wheels is a MUST. First impressions of the hotel were good, we were made to feel very welcome, we arrived early, about 12.30pm but only had to wait half an hour for our room to be made up, during which time we signed in, left our bags and were told to grab a drink at one of many of the nearby cafeâ€™s. When we returned the Manager, Maury welcomed us and helped carry our bags up to our room which was on the first floor, 203. The steps are quite steep, as they all are in Venice, although the hotel does have a stair lift for any guests who may require it. The room was compact, and the bathroom even more so. I remember a previous reviewer saying they called the shower a coffin, which was probably being generous. The hotel is classed as a three star which is generous and has probably been rewarded for the excellent customer service than the amenities of the hotel!!! Breakfast is standard fare although regardless of whether you get up early or late the staff will always ensure that you come away well fed, we tried to get away with just a cup of coffee but was stopped and given a tray of croissants, buns, spreads and biscuits to take away with us. The hotel is situated about 5/10 minutes walk from San Marco which lets you get into the midst of things quickly, but at the end of a busy day lets you relax in calmer (and cheaper) surroundings, it also gives you a little insight in to the real Venice. As a person who is always warm even I found the room cold, and pillows and blankets must be at a premium in Venice. We requested extra pillows and blankets but returned to find we had been given only one extra pillow between us, I returned to reception to be told by the porter that they didnâ€™t have anything else to give me, and only when I complained further did another pillow and blanket suddenly appear. We stayed during the Carnival by complete chance as I only booked the flights as they were so cheap, but I am so glad that we did. The atmosphere in San Marco square was fantastic and there was lots to do around the various districts. Venice is expensive, â‚¬8 for a large beer, (40cl, less than a pint!) so I would advise people to ask for a menu before sitting down as some places are more expensive than others, although keep an eye out for â€œhappy hoursâ€�. We can highly recommend the Jazz Bar for both cocktails and food. We enjoyed our time at the hotel, it was clean and reasonably comfortable, and although it wasnâ€™t my first choice, (I was limited due to the Carnival) I would recommend it, although feel that it belongs firmly in the budget hotel sector.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm”
Reviews.Author: amfra
Reviews.Content: Was told initially 5* by booking company - it most certainly is not. First room we had was at the top of 4 very steep flights of stairs, chair lift to first two. Shower so small if you weigh over 12 stone you literally wouldn't get in it.( door only slides half way) Bed right against wall and light switch, so when you turn over you switch on the light!!! Heating only just worked. Second room, we had to pay a supplement of 30 euros pn, was bigger and better, but one of the shower screen doors was held together with cellotape and fell off when shutting it. The breakfast was fine and the staff helpful, the area has good inexpensive restaurants and is close to the Arsenale water bus stop, but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: lrs17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a residential area of Venice, a nice change after spending all day in this tourist filled city. We stayed in an apartment across the street from the hotel, but after seeing pictures of the hotel rooms, we would have preferred to stay in those. It was clean and the AC was wonderful. Bathrooms were small, but not the worst we've experienced. Lots of very narrow flights of stairs for us.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: oddsocksMerseysideUk
Reviews.Content: Havin stayed at this hotel in june can highly recommend it ,but make sure you write down directions to get to hotel when you get off vaporetta cos it can be tricky to find. The day receptionist was fantastic & couldnt do enough for us, i was traveling with my mother so he put us in an apartment connected to the hotel so we wouldnt have to use the stairs to get to the rooms cos there are no lifts. The apartment was really nice & had good shower, it was cleaned everyday & the maids were very pleasent. We had wonderful time in venice but just keep in mind that it can be expensive especially to eat & a ride on a gondala is a must. So go enjoy venice, take a vaporetta over to the lido which is lovely & dont miss murano & burano.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: H0well
Reviews.Content: This would have been terrible to find without having taken notice of other reviews directions. It's about a 10 minute walk to St Mark's but only two vaporetto stops. The alilaguna bus from the airport stops at the Arsenale - get off here - turn right cross two bridges and walk about two hundred yards up the Via Garibaldi. Turn left before the big white church and then take first left again. This is a residential area and is quiet compared to the horrendous throngs of people you find at this time of year in central Venice. There are a couple of nice little restaurants along the Garibaldi also. Be aware that you cannot buy a cheap meal in restaurants in Venice though. The hotel was lovely - well maintained and very clean. The staff were really nice too. Our room was great and more than adequate for our family -we had our two boys (aged 7 & 5) with us. The air conditioning was great too! Breakfast was good and my husband recommends the coffee! I think this is a great hotel if a little far to walk at the end of a hot and busy day (esp. for the children), but we could have got the vaporetto so that's our problem I suppose!!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: louisanthony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an off site apartment that accomodated our family. It was clean yet the air conditioner was not adequate. We slept with the windows open which resulted in multiple insect bites. Also, the night staff was not helpful. The location is interesting in that it is away from the hordes of tourists in Venice. Be aware that Venice is very expensive for everything and very busy during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: ham_free
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at on our two week honeymoon to Italy. It was good to start here, as each hotel only improved as we continued travel. It was a fairly typical boutique European hotel...old uncomfortable (but king sized...nice!) bed & furniture, pathetic air-conditioner, lots of stairs to get to your room, etc. The bathroom was pretty spacious and had an awesome shower. It was clean and the maid was friendly. The location was pretty far from the center of Venice's main attraction, St. Mark's. We weren't prepared to haul our suitcases about a mile from the Vaporetto #82 stop in the 90 degree heat, or for the fact that the sign on the main street for the hotel (you have to go down an alley way to get to the back, where the entrance is) was about the size of a post-it note and we missed it, walking by it twice. Our only mishap of our entire trip was a result of bad advice we received from a front desk employee. We had to check out at 6:30am to catch a vaporetto to the train station. As the ticket booths are not open at that time, we asked how to buy a ticket ahead of time. He told us we could buy one on the boat. We boarded, and when they came by to take the tickets, we were slapped with a 36Euro fine each for not having a ticket, and were "made an example of" by the boat police. YOU CANNOT BUY A TICKET ON THE BOAT!!! Don't make the same foolish mistake we did. In hindsight, we should have taken a water taxi instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Mikenap15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of May for a couple of days. Staff is fantastic, breakfast is OK. We had an apartment off of Via Garibaldi that was outside of the Hotel. The furnishings were old, but we had a bedroom, living room and kitchen. Very big for Venice. Our rooms were extremely clean as well. The location was perfect for us. 10 minute walk along the water to San Marco. Two Vaporetto stops literally down the block but we walked everywhere anyway. The neighborhood is very residential and you get a true feel for how it is to live there. Plenty of markets etc. for food and snacks. There are many cheaper restauarants there as well (although we didn't eat in them). The hotel is hard to find if you don't pay specific attention to the directions outlined on other reviews. Be sure to have directions before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect find”
Reviews.Author: KatieA
Reviews.Content: Little gem of a hotel - although not in the heart of Venice, perfect to retreat to after long and busy day siteseeing. Just make sure you're not in the room on the ground floor as it's just next to the reception desk! Great service and manager cannot do enough to please. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but poor location”
Reviews.Author: kingmack91
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, big rooms. A litle slow to get hot water. Poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserjools
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel - and it was lovely. Although not in the "hub" of Venice, it was lovely to head back to the Via Garibaldi at the end of the day and sit in a cafe amongst the locals, sipping a "Spritz" and watching the sunset. The hotel was easy to locate from the waterbus stop, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the second floor which was quite a climb after a day's walking. Do not go here if you are at all challenged with agility, unless you can guarantee a room on the first floor, which is serviced by a chairlift. Our room was very traditionally furnished, with 3 windows (no views though) and a beautiful beamed ceiling. The shower room was very small but totally adequate. There was a fridge in the room which was useful for keeping our own drinks cool (minibar prices were fairly standard). We were woken each morning by the smell of sweet bread baking - and of course this led us quickly down to the beautiful breakfast room for an adequate breakfast of juices, cereals, yogurts, breads and croissants - and of course coffee (or tea). On our last day we were able to leave our luggage for most of the day while we went on one final walk into central Venice (10 minutes away). We would certainly stay here again; after seeing the bustle of central Venice - and the standard of some of the hotels there - this was definitely a good choice - top quality without all the tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money at this proper little hotel in Castello”
Reviews.Author: jarborra
Reviews.Content: I found the Corte Contarina on TripAdvisor and immediately booked ourselves a room for 5 nights (we paid â‚¬100 a night except for Friday which cost â‚¬180). My wife was initially worried that the hotel, which is off Via Garibaldi in Castello, would be too far off the beaten path, but this did not turn out to be the case. We arrived late from the airport, but the hotel had assured us this was fine as they have a 24h porter. We took the ACTV bus into P de Roma and then the No. 1 Vaporetto down to Arsenale. (It turns out taking the No. 52 to Giardini would have been quicker). From there, we walked over two bridges and turned left onto Via Garibaldi. Just by the little church San Francesco di Paola there was a helpful sign pointing the way and we found the hotel no problem. Our room was one floor up (no lift) and next to the breakfast area but this didn't disturb us much. The room itself was well furnished, had high frescoed ceilings, a good double bed, TV with CNN and Eurosport, closets with a safe, and a well equipped bathroom with a hairdryer and shower over the bath. It was all very clean, except for dust clinging to some of the light fixtures. Breakfast was, as most travellers to Italy will have realized, the standard caffe latte or cappucino served with four rolls of bread, two croissants (unfortunately stuffed with apricot jam), butter, marmalade and a Nutella knock-off, along with those two packaged pre-toasted slices no-one ever eats. There was unrefrigerated yoghurt to be had too, but we skipped that. The hotel is in a quiet side street and we were undisturbed for the duration of our stay. It was quite cold when we arrived and the hotel were unable to give us a second blanket (we got two extra sheets instead which we had to hide to stop the maid from taking them back) but once I figured out how to switch on the heated towel rail in the bathroom and that I could leave the door to the overly hot closet holding the minibar open, we were slightly warmer. Each morning we would either take the picturesque back alleys and canals past the imposing entrance to Arsenale to wherever we were going or walk down to the quay and go along the Grande Canal up to San Marco and the sights. Only rarely did we actually take the Vaporetto. It was a nice feeling to leave the hustle and bustle behind at the end of the day, and retire to the more congenial and residential Castello area. We left early on Saturday morning and the hotel kindly arranged breakfast for us out of hours, recommended a faster way of getting to the airport and processed our bill quickly and efficiently. All-in-all, I would highly recommend the Corte Contarina.

Reviews.Title: “Visitor from Sutherland, Scotland”
Reviews.Author: dixie-7
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to stay here for three days last weekend on a lastminute.com package for her 18th birthday. The flight schedule via Glasgow and Amsterdam had us arriving at San Zaccaria (near San Marco) around 1am after an hour on the Alilaguna boat from the airport. From there it was just ten minutesâ€™ walk along the promenade to the hotel (see helpful directions in previous posts). I agree wholeheartedly with other reviewers about the excellent location of the hotel â€“ crowd-free local shopping for all the necessities, but just a couple of minutes from all the souvenir stuff on the waterfront. All the food we ate out was good, but the nearest restaurant to the hotel, Trattoria Giorgione, had the added attraction of a singer-songwriter host. Heâ€™s accompanied by one of the waitresses, who sings really well herself. The hotel itself is comfortable, clean, and peaceful, and all the staff are friendly, helpful and polite. Breakfast was very nice indeed. The only quibble I had â€“ I appeared to be given the same mattress described by a writer in June 2005 â€“ was sorted out immediately, and I would have no hesitation at all in recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: wanderingdesi
Reviews.Content: loved this place. awesome room! huge bedroom with a huge bath.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel very near the centre”
Reviews.Author: Lara_Holmes
Reviews.Content: Although my stay in this hotel was in 2004, I felt compelled to add to the excellent reviews Corte Contarina has received! I stayed in this hotel with friends during the February Carnevale and thought every aspect was fantasic, especially given it was such a bargain, and really made our stay. As we paid so little for it being poor students at the time, and knowing it was very near the centre, we weren't expecting a lot. However it is an absolute gem of a hotel tucked away in quaint backstreets a short distance from the centre. The hotel itself was beautifully decorated with lovely big rooms (surpring for such a small hotel) and the breakfasts wonderful, with extremely friendly staff. The location is absolutely ideal within easy reach of all the main attractions. A real secret which I hope won't be spoilt by the many turists that visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Away Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travellers-L-M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away about 15 mins walk from San Marco and represents good value for money. Our room was on the top floor (77 steps!) but don't let this put you off because the room was clean and full of charm with lovely furnishings and an original beamed ceiling. The bed was comfortable and the shower room, although small, had all facilities and was very clean. Breakfast was fine-we had hot chocolate, cappucino, cereal, yogurt, croissant, bread rolls, french toast, jams, juice etc, We are very glad we found this hotel because it gave us the opportunity to walk along some of the less touristy areas and was only a few minutes from Arsenale or Giardini waterbus stops. The hotel was secure and friendly with a 24 hour concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Fave hotel during trip”
Reviews.Author: pnkyswr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Corte Contarina for 2 nights, and it was our favorite hotel during our trip to Venice, Florence and Rome. The accomodations were lovely. We were on the 4th floor and though it's a bit of a hike since there is not an elevator, we managed just fine. We loved the staff, who were always very friendly and helpful. When our luggage was lost, the owner, Mauro, repeatedly called the airport and our airline to find the luggage while we were out touring Venice. When we returned to the hotel that night, Mauro had taken our large suitcases up the three flights of stairs for us. We also loved the hotel because it's central enough (15 minute walk from St. Mark's square) and also allows you to experience Venice with the locals. The hotel is also located just off the very lively Via Garibaldi. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Janeandpete
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost us 179 pounds for four nights beginning of December. Quite easy to find; get off the vaporetti (get Number 1 through the Grand Canal from the Bus/train station - or 41/42) to Giardini and walk through the Giardina Garibaldi gardens to the Garibaldi monument, through the gates into the wide Via G. Garibaldi turn left and first right (down the side of a church; S.Francesco di poala) for twenty yards and first left and the hotel is there. Nice reception area, manned 24 hours by friendly staff. Two of the flights of stairs have an electric seat rise. On our floor the bedrooms were off the breakfast room. Smallish room with a double bed and an ensuite. The shower cubicle was a bit small as quite a bit of room was taken up by the large shower unit itself. I'm 6ft 1in and 16 stone so was a tight fit. However folk must remember that Venice is an ancient city, hundreds of years ago rooms were small and it's difficult - unless a new build - to actually have a lot of space. BUT it was adequate, and anyway no-one spends much time in their room in Venice! It was very quiet and we both slept well. Breakfast was between 8 and 10am and was quite substantial; cereal, bread rolls, croissants, cheeses, jams, biscuits, coffee/tea - I asked for more and got. No complaints with quality of room, breakfast, staff. Back on via Garibaldi there are a number of shops so easy to purchase 'snacks' for later and, being off the Tourist track the local evening meals were at local prices. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Corte Contarina”
Reviews.Author: roberts1892
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three fabulous days in Venice staying at this excellent value hotel. Situated between the Arsenale and Giardini vaporetto stops in an area of town dominated by locals this was the ideal base for our visit. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent english, breakfast was plentiful and we had a warm and comfortable room on the top floor. The only drawback was this meant climbing 75 stairs each time we went back to the room (but their was a chairlift for those less able). Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service in a Lovely and Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBond923
Reviews.Content: We spent the last four nights of our honeymoon in Venice after a cruise through the Greek isles. Hotel Corte Contarina is a gem. It's in a cute, non-touristy neighborhood a short (15 minute) walk to Piazza San Marco. The staff was truly friendly and helpful - the front desk manager went out of his way more than once to be of service to us, and he was genuinely sweet! The breakfast was delicious (freshly made croissants and perfect cappucinnos, plus cereal, fruit, yogurt, and other pastries) Our room turned out to be in a "new" part of the hotel, which was in a building a few blocks away from the actual hotel. Our room was actually a one-bedroom flat which had very recently been renovated (there was a still a bit of construction dust, and the sconces had not yet been installed in the bathroom). The flat was comfortable, spacious, and very private, but I was just a little disappointed that it was not decorated in the luxurious Venetian style like the other rooms in the hotel. Still, we enjoyed the privacy and the flat was comfortable and clean. I would highly recommend Hotel Corte Contarina as a good value for any tourist in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: hlgains
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Easyjet initially because it was cheap and cheerful. We were a little worried at first as we'd never visited Venice before, but this hotel and the area it was in was fantastic! We were on the top floor, which although there was a lot of stairs, it was worth it wake up and look out across the roofs in the morning. In the evenings the local trattorias along Via Garibaldi were lovely and reasonably priced, as well as being frequented by local Venetians - a good sign! Breakfast in the hotel was very good - all you can eat, delicious fresh croissants and rolls and the staff were helpful, friendly and always on hand when you needed them. One word of warning - finding it was a little traumatic as we arrived in the early evening once it was dark. We knew it was somewhere along Via Garbaldi, but had to ask some locals for directions - they obliged and showed us where to go - down the side of the church! But once we'd found it, the rest of the holiday was brilliant. When i return to Venice i will definately stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this small hotel on the internet and initially was attracted to the great value for money in comparison to some of the larger hotels in Venice. When we arrived we were not disappointed! Beautiful room (compact, but clean and beautifully furnished). Very kind and attentive staff (they brought me hot water every time I wanted a cup of tea!) Great breakfast! My only criticism would be that the front door was locked after midnight so when we came back late we had to get the porter to open the door...he didn't mind at all, but I felt a little guilty keeping him awake! Okay so there is no lift and a few stairs...but you are in Venice!!! If you want to visit an ancient city expect to stay in an ancient building!!!! Plus the thing you gain from Corte Contarina is that its not in an overly touristy area...in the evening you get to see real venetians socialising together in the street...you don't get that in the guide book!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 35th Wedding Anniversary venue”
Reviews.Author: Brackens
Reviews.Content: We needed a small quiet hotel to chill out from our busy work and family schedules.We wanted some time together without 21st Century distractions. Conte Contarini was perfect for that. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spotless and Room 201 had a spacious bathroom ( but no bath). The alleyways approaching the hotel were very narrow ( although well light) but added to its seclusion and peacefulness. There were restaurants and bars close by. The promenade along to the Piazzo San Marco was a daily pleasure, as was the No 1 vaporetto along the Grand Canal. We intend using this small, cheap hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Corte Contarina
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Contarina Castello 1931, 30122 Venice, Italy
